intro: Arctium verbascifolium, commonly known as the Canadian burdock, is a biennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and spiny, bur-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are yellow and appear in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in wet meadows, along stream banks, and in other wetland habitats.
